page.title: 17An Upton Family.
page.content: We interviewed a family in Upton.It was the{Rowan}family. The road where Mr and Mrs Rowan live is called{School {Street.}The estate was built by the National Coal Board for miners' families who worked at the local pit. The N.C.B.are selling these houses off. They are sold cheaply, costing about{Â£2,000 to buy}to the miners. Some of the houses therefore are owned by the N.C.B. and some are privately owned. The houses they live in are built in brick. The houses are in {rows of six.}They all have a back garden and a front garden. There is also a large common in the estate. There is a school next door and a bus stop in front. The estate is tightly knit. Mr and Mrs Rowan get on very well with the neighbours. The neighbours are also very kind to Mr and Mrs Rowan.
